Job Title: Project Manager

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Description

PRG is seeking a talented, experienced, and driven Construction Project Manager to join our team to lead cable and fiber construction projects. The Project Manager (Construction PM) is a liaison between management, the network organization, and/or vendors to provide solutions to meet client needs.

Major Duties And Responsibilities

Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.Lead business process design and documentation as needed.Create workflows and convey findings in PowerPoint presentations and VisioWrite and own functional and technical business requirements from end-to-endSupport Project Management and developing project plans, using associated project planning tools as needed.Analyze business operations to determine improvement opportunities and automate processes and functions.Support integrating new products and services, regulatory requirements, tools, and technologies in existing operations.Negotiate agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business units and technical solution teams from initial requirements to final implementation.Conduct feasibility studies and testing to assess the cost/benefit, efficiency, and technical viability of solutions to business problems.


Skills/Abilities And Knowledge

Ability to read, write, speak, and understand EnglishWorking knowledge of cable television operations and processesExcellent interpersonal skills and ability to present performance feedback effectivelyExcellent presentation skillsStrong analytical abilityAbility to work independentlyExperience with MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPointBachelorâ€™s degree or 5+ years of related experienceTelecommunications Industry experience is a major plus.


Related Work Experience

3+ years experience in Business Analysis with experience in process documentation, requirements gathering, product development, and project implementationStrategic, proactive, and critical thinker; able to uncover weaknesses in policies and procedures and suggest areas of improvementDetail-oriented; ability to analyze business objectives and goals on an investigative level


WORKING CONDITIONS

On-site

Still a good fit? If so, the selected candidate will enjoy the following perks and compensation:

$90,000 - $100,000 per year plus mileage reimbursement and annual bonus.Health benefits include medical, dental & vision for you and your dependents in the first month following your start date.Company-paid Short-term Disability benefits after one year of service.401(k) Plan on the first month following your start date with a safe-harbor match after one year of service.Supplemental Life Insurance is offered for you and your dependents.ClassPass shared cost membership is offered to each employee.Paid time off and holiday pay to enjoy time with friends and family.
